node.title: Muslims remain at risk of being targeted by terrorists within NZ, coroner told
node.description: The Islamic Women's Council has told a coronial hearing into the Christchurch mosque attacks that Muslims are still in danger of being targeted by terrorists in New Zealand.
node.content:
["The Islamic Women's Council has told a coronial hearing into the Christchurch mosque attacks that Muslims are still in danger of being targeted by terrorists in New Zealand.", "", "
Aliya Danzeisen told a coronial inquiry the Islamic Women's Council's leadership has been threatened with poisoning, rape and being killed since the 2019 massacre. Photo: RNZ / Luke McPake
", "The coronial hearing is examining the final moments in the lives of 51 Muslims murdered in the Christchurch terror attacks on 15 March 2019.", "The inquiry was opened to address any unanswered questions following the criminal investigation and prosecution process and the Royal Commission of Inquiry.", "Its purpose is to establish the circumstances of the deaths and make recommendations to reduce the chance of other attacks happening in similar circumstances.", "The Islamic Women's Council has asked Coroner Brigitte Windley to examine the role of radicalisation on digital platforms as part of the inquiry.", "The Australian gunman who carried out the attacks immersed himself in far-right content online.", "Council national coordinator Aliya Danzeisen told the coronial hearing today that the council believes innocent lives could have been saved if authorities had delved into the virtual life of the terrorist.", "She said Muslims are still in danger of being targeted by terrorists in New Zealand.", "The council's leadership has been threatened with poisoning, rape and being killed since the massacre.", "She said there is a clear and present danger of a similar attack to the 2019 one, which has been recognised by authorities in recent months.", "The council has repeatedly raised an alarming rise in hatred and harassment online with the government and media companies, she said.", "However, digital platforms have been unwilling or unable to tackle online radicalisation.", "The entire coronial hearing is being held remotely, via video link, because of the Covid-19 risk.", "It is expected to finish tomorrow.", "", "
Coroner Brigitte Handley is overseeing the hearing. Photo: POOL / STUFF LTD
"]
